about_the_game:
Learning, but with a Light Touch !

If math feels as indigestible as a litter box to you, this game might just change that! Dive into a playful and colorful world where trigonometry becomes a true narrative game, filled with humor and lovable characters.

Light Touch , but withlearning!

In La Litière Trigo, trigonometry will no longer be an abstract concept !

The game focuses on explaining not only the essential basics but also the "why" behind the math. Through light dialogue and accessible explanations, the concepts become concrete and easy to understand.

A training tailored to your level will be offered to you during the final phase !

This game is literally a private tutoring session in the form of a video game.

For what levels?

La Litière Trigo is designed for students who are just beginning to learn about trigonometry, like sine and cosine, and continues through to more advanced concepts like the unit circle and radians:

  • United States : generally introduced in 10th or 11th grade as part of Algebra 2 or Precalculus​

  • United Kingdom : Basic trigonometry concepts are usually introduced in Year 10 and continue into Year 11 with more advanced applications covered in A-Level Maths for older students.

  • Australia : concepts often appear during Year 9, with more advanced concepts covered in Year 10 or 11 as part of Precalculus or higher math courses.

  • Canada - Quebec : is introduced in 4e secondaire, with more advanced topics continuing into 5e secondaire

  • Canada - outside Quebec : generally introduced as part of Algebra 2 or Precalculus, often in 10th or 11th grade.

This game is suitable for students aged 13 to 17, depending on the country, but it’s also useful for anyone looking to strengthen or review their trigonometry basics.
